member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.Status
member.summary: Gets the HTTP status code. For streaming responses, this is typically 200.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.ReasonPhrase
member.summary: Gets the reason phrase. For streaming responses, this is typically "OK".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.ContentStream
member.summary: Streaming responses do not support direct content stream access.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.Content
member.summary: Streaming responses do not support direct content access.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.HeadersCore
member.summary: Streaming responses do not have headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.BufferContent(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Buffering content is not supported for streaming responses.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.BufferContentAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Buffering content asynchronously is not supported for streaming responses.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenAI.StreamingUpdatePipelineResponse.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes resources. No resources to dispose for streaming response.

member.name: T:OpenAI.AgentRunResponseExtensions

member.summary: Creates or extracts a native OpenAI object from an .

member.summary: Creates or extracts a native OpenAI object from an .

member.name: T:OpenAI.AIAgentWithOpenAIExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for to simplify interaction with OpenAI chat messages and return native OpenAI responses.
member.remarks: These extensions bridge the gap between the Microsoft Extensions AI framework and the OpenAI SDK, allowing developers to work with native OpenAI types while leveraging the AI Agent framework. The methods handle the conversion between OpenAI chat message types and Microsoft Extensions AI types, and return OpenAI objects directly from the agent's .

member.name: M:OpenAI.AIAgentWithOpenAIExtensions.RunAsync(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenAI.Chat.ChatMessage},Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentThread,Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentRunOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the AI agent with a collection of OpenAI chat messages and returns the response as a native OpenAI .
member.param: The AI agent to run.
The collection of OpenAI chat messages to send to the agent.
The conversation thread to continue with this invocation. If not provided, creates a new thread. The thread will be mutated with the provided messages and agent response.
Optional parameters for agent invocation.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation that returns a native OpenAI response.
member.exception: Thrown when the agent's response cannot be converted to a , typically when the underlying representation is not an OpenAI response.
Thrown when any message in has a type that is not supported by the message conversion method.
member.remarks: This method converts the OpenAI chat messages to the Microsoft Extensions AI format using the appropriate conversion method, runs the agent with the converted message collection, and then extracts the native OpenAI from the response using .

member.name: M:OpenAI.AIAgentWithOpenAIExtensions.RunStreamingAsync(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpenAI.Chat.ChatMessage},Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentThread,Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentRunOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the AI agent with a single OpenAI chat message and returns the response as collection of native OpenAI .
member.param: The AI agent to run.
The collection of OpenAI chat messages to send to the agent.
The conversation thread to continue with this invocation. If not provided, creates a new thread. The thread will be mutated with the provided message and agent response.
Optional parameters for agent invocation.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation that returns a native OpenAI response.
member.exception: Thrown when the agent's response cannot be converted to a , typically when the underlying representation is not an OpenAI response.
Thrown when the type is not supported by the message conversion method.
member.remarks: This method converts the OpenAI chat messages to the Microsoft Extensions AI format using the appropriate conversion method, runs the agent, and then extracts the native OpenAI from the response using .

member.name: T:OpenAI.OpenAIAssistantClientExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for OpenAI to simplify the creation of AI agents that work with OpenAI services.
member.remarks: These extensions bridge the gap between OpenAI SDK client objects and the Microsoft Agent Framework, allowing developers to easily create AI agents that leverage OpenAI's chat completion and response services. The methods handle the conversion from OpenAI clients to instances and then wrap them in objects that implement the interface.

member.summary: Creates an AI agent from an using the OpenAI Assistant API.
member.param: The OpenAI to use for the agent.
The model identifier to use (e.g., "gpt-4").
Optional system instructions that define the agent's behavior and personality.
Optional name for the agent for identification purposes.
Optional description of the agent's capabilities and purpose.
Optional collection of AI tools that the agent can use during conversations.
Provides a way to customize the creation of the underlying used by the agent.
Optional logger factory for enabling logging within the agent.
member.returns: An instance backed by the OpenAI Assistant service.
member.exception: Thrown when is empty or whitespace.

member.name: T:OpenAI.OpenAIChatClientExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for to simplify the creation of AI agents that work with OpenAI services.
member.remarks: These extensions bridge the gap between OpenAI SDK client objects and the Microsoft Agent Framework, allowing developers to easily create AI agents that leverage OpenAI's chat completion and response services. The methods handle the conversion from OpenAI clients to instances and then wrap them in objects that implement the interface.

member.summary: Creates an AI agent from an using the OpenAI Chat Completion API.
member.param: The OpenAI to use for the agent.
Optional system instructions that define the agent's behavior and personality.
Optional name for the agent for identification purposes.
Optional description of the agent's capabilities and purpose.
Optional collection of AI tools that the agent can use during conversations.
Provides a way to customize the creation of the underlying used by the agent.
Optional logger factory for enabling logging within the agent.
An optional to use for resolving services required by the instances being invoked.
member.returns: An instance backed by the OpenAI Chat Completion service.

member.summary: Run the agent with the provided message and arguments.
member.param: The messages to pass to the agent.
The conversation thread to continue with this invocation. If not provided, creates a new thread. The thread will be mutated with the provided messages and agent response.
Optional parameters for agent invocation.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
